intro: Achyronia capillaris, commonly known as the slender false nettle, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, opposite leaves with a slightly serrated edge. Its flowers are usually pink or white, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
